div.p: Greetings. I have received your letters, dearest brother, and I have nothing at present to respond to them or to add from my own. This one thing I ask of you as much as I can, that you send these enclosed letters, written to my nephew from my brother, who is taking the waters with his ailing wife at the Pf√§fers baths, without delay and as soon as you conveniently can.

Farewell forever with all our brothers and friends. If you have any news of Italian affairs, the Venetian and Turkish war, the Roman pontiff, the Milanese, and other similar matters, I ask you to share them. Farewell again.
To the most distinguished man, Tobias Egli, minister of the Chur church, an honorable lord and beloved brother.
